premises: If a person thinks, then they exist
incorrect conclusions: A person exists implies that a person thinks
A person does not exist implies that a person thinks
If a person does not think, then a person does not exist

premises: If an action is morally good, then it maximizes happiness
incorrect conclusions: An action does not maximize happiness
An action maximizes happiness implies that an action is morally good
An action does not maximize happiness implies that an action is morally good
If an action is not morally good, then it does not maximize happiness

premises: If humans have free will, then they are morally responsible for their actions
conclusions: Humans are morally responsible for their actions
incorrect conclusions: Humans are not morally responsible for their actions
Humans are morally responsible for their actions implies that humans have free will
Humans are not morally responsible for their actions implies that humans have free will
If humans do not have free will, then they are not morally responsible for their actions
